definition: (of prices, rates etc) to remain high
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
(negative prefix)/not/no
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The vintage was not good but the prices remained high.
sentences.chinese: 雖然酒的年份不佳，但是其價格始終居高不下。

sentences.english: In our country, the episodes of injury and death from traffic accident are high all the way.
sentences.chinese: 在我國，道路交通傷害發生率和傷亡率居高不下。

sentences.english: The flow of credit remains constrained, economic activity weak, and unemployment much too high.
sentences.chinese: 信貸仍然偏緊，經濟活動疲軟，失業率居高不下。

sentences.english: State government is in an even worse mess, with budget deficits stretching to the horizon and high and persistent unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府的情況更糟，赤字高築，失業率居高不下。

sentences.english: It has sky-high unemployment yet at the same time suffers from crippling skills shortages.
sentences.chinese: 它的失業率居高不下，同時工作人員的工作技能短缺。

sentences.english: Unemployment in black ghettos remained consistently higher than in white communities.
sentences.chinese: 較之於白人社區，黑人區的失業人數也一直居高不下。

sentences.english: The cost of meat in particular is running high, according to a wholesale price survey by the Agriculture Department.
sentences.chinese: 根據農業部的一項批發價調查，肉類價格居高不下。

sentences.english: Within a few years, financial-industry profits were at an all-time high.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，金融業的豐厚回報一直居高不下。

sentences.english: At the same time, the current rate of nolle prosequi in administration ease is increasing every year.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，我國行政案件撤訴率常年居高不下。

sentences.english: The relapse rate of drug addicts after detoxification is still very high.
sentences.chinese: 但收效甚微，復吸率居高不下。

sentences.english: Much of Americans' frustration concerns the nation's stubborn 10-percent unemployment rate. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 美國人的擔憂大多與居高不下的10%的失業率有關。

definition: in recent years
to rise rapidly/to soar
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
year after year/with each passing year/over the years
to increase without letup/to get worse and worse (idiom)
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
for the past few years
to fully experience (good or bad)
the last few years/last several years/recent years
sharp increase/rapid growth
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
temperature/heat/short-lived enthusiasm
to stand above/to occupy an important position/to rank (among the top few)
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to increase rapidly/to shoot up
